|Title=Knowing the causes of unwanted pregnancies
|Description=Absence of contraception, change of method, unsuitable method. Know that two thirds of women who have had a termination were using a contraceptive method. Unwanted pregnancy does not always lead to abortion
|Rubric=Etiologies
|Contributors=Arthur Foulon,Philippe Deruelle,Aubert Agostini
|Order=2}}

There are a number of factors that can lead to an abortion:

- lack of contraception

- a lack of information on what to do if you forget to take a pill or if you have a condom 'accident'.

- a recent change of method with a failure to comply with the changeover rules

- an unsuitable / ineffective method

It should be borne in mind that 2/3 of women who undergo a termination have contraception. An unwanted pregnancy does not systematically lead to a termination.

question.title: What is a common reason for a woman to undergo a termination of pregnancy?

option_a.title: A recent change of method with a failure to comply with the changeover rules
option_a.description: A common reason for a woman to undergo a termination of pregnancy

option_b.title: An unsuitable / ineffective method
option_b.description: A common reason for a woman to undergo a termination of pregnancy

option_c.title: The presence of a genetic disorder in the fetus
option_c.description: A potential reason for a woman to undergo a termination of pregnancy

option_d.title: The age of the woman at the time of conception
option_d.description: A factor that may influence a woman's decision to undergo a termination of pregnancy

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The letter of the correct answer
